Text: September 18, 2019 By: Spencer Israel Saturday's drone strikes against Saudi Aramco oil facilities in Abqaiq and Khurais has given the oil market a shock the likes of which it hasn't seen in years, and the ramifications are heavy. Five percent of the world's daily oil output has been disrupted, or 5.7 million barrels/day, the biggest disruption in history (and bigger than the 5.6 million b/d disruption during the Iranian Revolution of 1978-79).
Cause: September 18, 2019 By: Spencer Israel Saturday's drone strikes against Saudi Aramco oil facilities in Abqaiq and Khurais has given the oil market a shock the likes of which it hasn't seen in years, and the ramifications are heavy.
Effect: Five percent of the world's daily oil output has been disrupted, or 5.7 million barrels/day, the biggest disruption in history (and bigger than the 5.6 million b/d disruption during the Iranian Revolution of 1978-79).
